Resource-reckoning: eliminating the efficiency gap between building design and use
Buildings are being designed to meet stringent green targets and office occupiers are demanding that their offices are more sustainable than ever before. But are we actually creating energy efficient workplaces that also reflect the wants, needs and cost demands of occupiers?
AECOM and Estates Gazette invite you to the second in their series of discussions looking at the future of offices and their occupiers. In this session, we will examine how we can make the most of all resources, from space to IT and energy, to ensure we are getting the most out of our workplaces.
To watch highlights of the first event – The Next Generation Occupier – visit AECOM’s YouTube channel
Panel members
Samantha McClary Deputy Editor/Head of Content at Estates Gazette (Chair)
Richard Jackson Director, Sustainability, UCL
Lydia Dutton Project Manager (Environmental), Argent LLP
Nicola Gillen EMEA Practice Lead – Strategy+, AECOM
Dave Cheshire Regional Director – Sustainability, AECOM
See Further Events Our times are marked by change. By getting together we find out more, we stay ahead, we lead rather than follow. So, let’s talk.
